Class SyndicationExtension

Provides the set of methods, properties and events that web content syndication extensions should inherit from.

Inheritance

Namespace: Argotic.Extensions
Assembly: Argotic.Extensions.dll
Syntax
[Serializable]
public abstract class SyndicationExtension : ISyndicationExtension, IXmlSerializable
Remarks

The SyndicationExtension abstract class is provided to reduce the difficulty of implementing custom syndication extensions. While implementers are free to implement their custom syndication extensions by implementing the ISyndicationExtension interface, it is recommended that custom syndication extensions inherit from the SyndicationExtension base class.

If you choose to not inherit from the SyndicationExtension abstract base class, please be aware that the SyndicationExtensionAdapter class internally calls the System.Activator.CreateInstance(System.Type) method, and so any custom syndication extension will need to have the appropriate SecurityPermissionAttribute and ReflectionPermissionAttribute attributes applied as necessary.

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

CreateNamespaceManager(XPathNavigator)

Initializes a System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager object for resolving prefixed XML namespaces utilized by this SyndicationExtension.

Declaration
public XmlNamespaceManager CreateNamespaceManager(XPathNavigator navigator)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator navigator

Provides a cursor model for navigating syndication extension data.
Returns
Type Description
System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager

A System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager that resolves prefixed XML namespaces and provides scope management for these namespaces.
Remarks

This method will return a System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager that has a namespace added to it using the XmlPrefix and XmlNamespace of the extension unless the supplied System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator already has an XML namespace associated to the XmlPrefix, in which case the associated XML namespace is used instead. This is to prevent collisions and is an attempt to gracefully handle the case where a XML namespace that is not per the extension's specification has been declared on the syndication resource.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The navigator is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
| Improve this Doc View Source

ExistsInSource(XPathNavigator)

Determines if the SyndicationExtension exists in the XML data in the supplied System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.

Declaration
public virtual bool ExistsInSource(XPathNavigator source)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator source

The System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator to parse.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if the SyndicationExtension elements or attributes are present in the source; otherwise false.
Remarks

This method should be as lightweight as possible when determining if the SyndicationExtension or its related entities are present in the source. The default implementation utilizes the System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator.GetNamespacesInScope(System.Xml.XmlNamespaceScope) method to determine if the source contains the expected namespace(s) for this SyndicationExtension.

It is recommended that you call this method prior to executing a possibly costly load operation using the Load(IXPathNavigable) method.

| Improve this Doc View Source

GetSchema()

This method is reserved and should not be used. When implementing the System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable interface, it is recommended that a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned from this method, and instead, if specifying a custom schema is required, to apply the System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProviderAttribute to the class.

Declaration
public XmlSchema GetSchema()
Returns
Type Description
System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema

A System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema object that represents an in-memory representation of an XML Schema as specified in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Schema Structures and Datatypes specifications. The default return value for this method is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Remarks

When serializing or deserializing an object, the System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer class does not perform XML validation. For this reason, it is often safe to omit schema information by providing a trivial implementation of this method, for example by returning a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Some .NET Framework types as well as legacy custom types implementing the System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable interface may be using System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.GetSchema() instead of System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProviderAttribute. In this case, the method returns an accurate XML schema that describes the XML representation of the object generated by the WriteXml(XmlWriter) method.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Load(XmlReader)

Initializes the syndication extension using the supplied System.Xml.XmlReader.

Declaration
public abstract bool Load(XmlReader reader)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Xml.XmlReader reader

The XmlReader used to load the syndication extension.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if the SyndicationExtension was able to be initialized using the supplied reader; otherwise false.
Remarks

Notes to Implementers:

  • When implementing this method, the System.Xml.XmlReader should be used to create a System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable that is then passed to the Load(IXPathNavigable) method.
  • After the load operation has successfully completed, the Loaded event must be raised.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The reader is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
| Improve this Doc View Source
